question.text: Which of the following is a mismatched pair?

options.text: Species richness - related to explored geographical area

solution.text:
During his pioneering and extensive explorations in the wilderness of South American jungles, the great German naturalist and geographer Alexander von Humboldt observed that within a region species richness increased with increasing explored area, but only up to a limit. In fact, the relation between species richness and area for a wide variety of taxa (angiosperm plants, birds, bats, freshwater fishes) turns out to be a rectangular hyperbola.
On a logarithmic scale, the relationship is a straight line described by the equation
log S = log C + Z log A
where S= Species richness A= Area Z = slope of the line (regression coefficient) C = Y-intercept
